full_text: On May 4, York County will host the first @givelocalyork day. Communities from around the county will host events to celebrate the good work done by local non-profits & encourage others to get involved and give back. To learn more please visit https://t.co/zQHCZ2U0x8.
National Prescription Drug Take Back Day is this Saturday, April 28. https://t.co/T1NDxuvGsu

The @HouseHomeland Security Committee will examine the appropriations requests for the DHS and work to prioritize taxpayer resources to ensure the Nation’s security on Thursday, April 26, at 10:00 a.m. Please tune in here: https://t.co/bMs946CGun

I was privileged to join new Eagle Scouts and their families at our 4th Congressional District Annual Scout Celebration. These are outstanding young Americans who continually give back to our communities, and I’m extremely proud to know them. Keep up the great work, gentlemen! https://t.co/cxxfaAZDDj

I’m so saddened to learn of the passing of Former First Lady Barbara Bush. While she was witty and tenacious, she was the epitome of grace throughout her entire life. She adored her family as well as our Country. Mrs. Bush will be missed dearly. Godspeed and God Bless.

Many thanks to the @PAGrangePR, including Vince Phillips of Mechanicsburg, who came to DC to discuss the Farm Bill Reauthorization & high-speed internet access in rural areas with me. I appreciate your time in sharing your priorities as Congress continues to work on these issues. https://t.co/ZmCT7B1ESc

The @HouseForeign Affairs Committee will hold a hearing on Wed. at 10a about US policy throughout a turbulent Middle East following missile strikes in Syria and violence in Yemen, plus an upcoming key deadline on the Iran Nuclear Deal. Please tune in here: https://t.co/BGNYhWMJsX
https://t.co/sIQiDAEp0t

Tomorrow at 10 a.m. the @HouseHomeland Security Committee’s Subcommittee on Oversight and Management Efficiency, which I chair, will hold a hearing examining efforts by the DHS to consolidate its headquarters in SE DC. Please tune in here: https://t.co/wMD17Xky4F

The @HouseForeign Affairs Committee will host a hearing on efforts to denuclearize North Korea. We must hold rogue regimes accountable and save innocent lives. The hearing begins at 2 p.m. today. Please visit the link below to watch the hearing live: https://t.co/7uVjje5mCO
https://t.co/YI6IN9Cg9A

April is Child Abuse Prevention Month. Each year our Office partners with the York County Children’s Advocacy Center to plant a pinwheel garden to raise awareness of child abuse in our community. To learn how you can help, please visit https://t.co/9RYTSvc7cb. https://t.co/HQgMWWr3K5

I was privileged to meet with @YouthBuildUSA participants from Central PA. Their stories are why I’m proud to lead a bipartisan group of 151 Members of Congress in supporting YouthBuild USA during the appropriations process for FY19. https://t.co/VEeQxcYE0S

Another great series of constituent meetings this week in York to discuss tax reform, Net Neutrality, climate change, Alzheimer’s research & more. I greatly appreciate these citizens taking time out of their schedule to be engaged on the issues that impact our Nation & community. https://t.co/pU9e2LdbFi

Many thanks to PENNAIR and the York County Economic Alliance for a great discussion in York on the positive, local impacts of tax reform. After the bill’s passage, PENNAIR immediately made investments to improve its business, and is poised for even greater growth in the future. https://t.co/biCdGj35M4
For those who celebrate, I wish you a blessed Good Friday and joyous, peaceful Easter. https://t.co/IKafry059e

A public Memorial Service will be held in honor of Ivan Flanscha and Zachary Anthony, our Fallen York City Firefighters. We’re indebted to Ivan and Zachary and their families and we’ll continue to keep them in our hearts during this devastating time. https://t.co/Y4bXX9EeA5

Big changes are coming to I-83. To help keep the public updated, PennDOT is holding an Open House on Thursday, March 29 from 6:30 pm – 8:00 pm at Central York Middle School. Interested in attending? Visit https://t.co/xhYbXeiDgL. @PennDOTNews

Harrisburg Bureau of Fire Chief Brian Enterline is a great public servant. We’ve been privileged to work with him over the years and send all our prayers to him and his family for a fast and complete recovery.
https://t.co/2aP9JDI8dg

Did you know you can sign up for periodic email updates through our website? If you’d like information about the latest happenings around our Fourth Congressional District, and Washington, delivered right to your inbox, please visit the link below. https://t.co/N8JMUGBeVp

The 2018 Congressional Art Competition is underway. High School students from PA-4 are encouraged to submit artwork for a chance to have it displayed in the U.S. Capitol and to win a renewable scholarship. For full rules visit https://t.co/UeuX57ND3X.  Competition ends 4/13/18.

I was privileged to host members of the @YMCA from across Pennsylvania during the organization’s recent National Advocacy Day in Washington. These students did a great job advocating for the invaluable community programs offered by the YMCA. https://t.co/V9cG8gmFBk

March is National Women’s History Month. Today, we pause to celebrate the contributions of women in the Commonwealth and our Nation. Thanks for all you do to advance the cause of equality and justice. https://t.co/LARn3fkqUf

The @HouseHomeland Security Committee has released its February Terror Threat Snapshot. To date, DHS has thwarted more than 150 homegrown terrorist attacks. https://t.co/xcvHVpagLs https://t.co/Jo3ywajvf1

The Reverend Billy Graham, famed Christian Evangelist and Spiritual Advisor to several U.S. Presidents, will lie in honor at the U.S. Capitol today. Reverend Graham leaves behind an incredible legacy of love, humility and courage. He will be deeply missed. https://t.co/RcDHKHrNZC

Really enjoyed an interview with students from The Gettysburgian and 91.1 WZBT, the student-run newspaper and radio station from Gettysburg College. We discussed immigration reform, the 2nd Amendment, Congressional re-districting and the budget. Thanks all for your time! https://t.co/m2b4wSclsZ

ICYMI: Congrats to Glen Rock’s Summer Britcher for a great run at the Pyeongchang 2018 Winter Olympics in South Korea - the 4th District is incredibly proud of you! You’re a true champion. https://t.co/WpgOwPEcKI

As I’ve emphasized repeatedly since being elected to Congress, Russian hostility towards our Nation mustn’t go unanswered. Today’s announcement confirms a stark  escalation in Russian aggression against American interests. https://t.co/ZniHzNFhLF https://t.co/TE1FFDL9p7
Florida - you’re in my heart and prayers. https://t.co/l52F4in0VJ
CVS Pharmacy is the latest company to put its dollars to better use because of Tax Reform – to include paid family leave for all employees. https://t.co/jyfHVW3O05 #TaxReformWorks

Great series of constituent meetings earlier this week in York to discuss federal trucking regulations, transportation & infrastructure, the opioid crisis & other issues. If you’re interested in scheduling a meeting, please visit: https://t.co/3pTHwRvCjZ https://t.co/KDxTDUQsPq

Great to see that the @POTUS FY2019 budget focuses on infrastructure. Our transportation/infrastructure systems are crucial to our economy, incl. access to jobs, health care & education. I have questions about the plan, but am excited about moving forward. https://t.co/PpnQDKuZ8B

Great thanks to my dear friend, @RepJenniffer, the Cong. Delegate to Puerto Rico, for coming to York Monday to discuss the ongoing recovery & see local efforts to help our fellow citizens. The Puerto Rico Se Levanta raised more than $15K & provided many supplies to those in need. https://t.co/cd6OUWO20e

The federal government is set to run a trillion dollar deficit this year alone - DOUBLE that of FY17; a disgrace.  While we’re on track for greater economic growth thanks to Tax Reform, we simply must deal with the SPENDING side of the equation as well. https://t.co/oC97sv8AZ5

2/2 I appreciate your interest and we’ll get another one scheduled as soon as we can.  Sign up for my e-newsletter and follow me on my Facebook page, https://t.co/HBhFQ8H2U4 for updates regarding the rescheduling of this and future events.
1/2 Our tele-town hall, previously scheduled for this evening, Tuesday, February 6, at 6:30 p.m., had to be postponed due to the vote schedule this evening.

What a great privilege to be asked to speak again before the highly qualified/skilled Officers and NCOs of the National Defense University's National Security Course.  Thank you for the privilege, and for what you sacrifice daily for our Nation. https://t.co/BJk8nwP6xF

Releasing this memo is the first step to rooting out corruption in our bureaucratic agencies once and for all. The American people deserved to know its contents and I’m glad we were able to get this into the public sphere. #readthememo https://t.co/ICP8p67vtM  #Releasethememo
It’s Groundhog Day and it looks like we’ll have 6 more weeks of Winter… Thanks a lot Punxsutawney Phil! https://t.co/j9NLyq3vsJ
Congressman Perry was on the train but is fine – and is praying for the truck driver’s family. We’ll continue to monitor the situation. https://t.co/dOa0hKopnr

I joined with 65 of my colleagues to call for the public release of the FISA abuse memo. While the details are classified, our gov’s surveillance powers should never be used against a US citizen without strict Constitutional protections. #releasethememo https://t.co/8uEsO3dJkv
https://t.co/YQv1GYN4TL

Tonight President Donald J. Trump will deliver the State of the Union address to a Joint Session of Congress. I’m looking forward to hearing his vision for the next year in office. Be sure to tune in at 9 p.m. EST to hear the President live. Check your local listings.

Did you know you can sign up for periodic email updates through our website? If you’d like information about the latest happenings around our Fourth Congressional District, and Washington, delivered right to your inbox, please visit the link below. https://t.co/N8JMUGBeVp

I was on @FoxNews to discuss how imperative a long-term spending bill is. The House passed all 12 Approps bills in Sept.; I’ve called on the Senate to get to work on the House proposals repeatedly. These manufactured budget crises are beyond ridiculous. https://t.co/vzxoFH94dT
2/2 Our debt to the selfless and courageous men and women “in blue,” who risk everything to keep us safe every day, will never be paid.

1/2 My prayers are with our law enforcement involved in the shooting in Hbrg this morning, especially the family of the Fallen U.S. Marshal. I’m incredulous, furious and saddened by this senseless tragedy.

Updated: I’ll be on Your World with Neil Cavuto on Fox News around 4:30pm this afternoon. Charles Payne is guest hosting and we’ll discuss efforts to ensure that a long-term government funding proposal is enacted before the Friday deadline. I hope you’ll tune in. https://t.co/6B2zltSh6Q

I’ll be on Your World with Neil Cavuto on @FoxNews around 4:10 pm this afternoon. Charles Payne (@cvpayne) is guest hosting and we’ll discuss efforts to ensure that a long-term government funding proposal is enacted before the Friday deadline. I hope you’ll tune in.

Another great year at the Farm Show serving some of the best milkshakes on the planet!  I can’t count how many years I’ve been doing this now, but it gets better and more fun every time!   Thanks to all who helped, supported and...enjoyed! https://t.co/aQPyFZh0Hm

With the Christmas season in full swing, let’s not forget those who selflessly serve our Nation in uniform. I was proud to join the @RedCross for their Holiday Mail for Heroes campaign. I extend my tireless gratitude to our Service Members and their families. https://t.co/9mTtTTDPSr
